blue-white.Name: Floral Planter - Large - Blue and White - Antiqued Look

During the manufacturing process imperfections have been deliberately created. These give the item an older, used  and more 'antique' look than it would have if it had been made to be perfect. There may be parts of a design missing, slight bumps or other surface imperfections or irregularities in the glaze. These are meant to give the careworn and well used look of a much older item to a recently manufactured product. This distressed finish is not to be regarded as a fault.

blue-white.Name: Peony hand painted Ginger Jar
blue-white.Body:
Peony Ginger Jar.

Peonies bloom in the spring season and symbolise fame, prosperity, and wealth

It was the great Chinese poet Li Bai who compared his mistress Yang Yuhuan’s beauty to peonies. He wrote: “Floating clouds remind me of her clothes, and peonies her face”. In most of the New Year images, the fairy children always hold peonies. The peonies bear people’s wishes for an auspicious and rich new year.

blue-white.Body:
A pair of Classic Blue ceramic Foo Dogs. Beautiful ornaments for your home.
Foo dogs are symbolic, protective statues – one is female and one is male. The female represents yin and symbolically protects the people dwelling in the home, while the male represents yang, protects the structure itself.

Sold and Delivered as a Pair.

This piece was made in Jingdezhen, China - known as the "Porcelain Capital" because it has been producing Chinese ceramics for at least 1,000 years, and is known for producing the most important and finest quality porcelain in China.

This item is finished with a crackle glaze technique - this makes the item look older and  antiqued and unique as every item is different.

Chrysanthemums are one of the most common flowers in China and are symbolic of autumn and of the ninth lunar month. The Chinese word for chrysanthemum is similar to jū, which means "to remain" and jiǔ which means "long time." Therefore, chrysanthemums symbolize duration and long life.

In Chinese philosophy, the Plum tree's blossom is a symbol of winter ending and a herald of spring. The tree's pale pink blossoms are cherished because they bloom vibrantly and so bravely amidst the winter chill. They symbolise perseverance and hope, as well as, beauty thriving in adverse circumstances. Bamboo is a symbol of strength, flexibility, and growth.

homepage-featured.Name: Peony hand painted Ginger Jar
homepage-featured.Body:
Peony Ginger Jar.

Peonies bloom in the spring season and symbolise fame, prosperity, and wealth

It was the great Chinese poet Li Bai who compared his mistress Yang Yuhuan’s beauty to peonies. He wrote: “Floating clouds remind me of her clothes, and peonies her face”. In most of the New Year images, the fairy children always hold peonies. The peonies bear people’s wishes for an auspicious and rich new year.

This item is finished with a crackle glaze technique - this makes the item look older and  antiqued and unique as every item is different.

Chrysanthemums are one of the most common flowers in China and are symbolic of autumn and of the ninth lunar month. The Chinese word for chrysanthemum is similar to jū, which means "to remain" and jiǔ which means "long time." Therefore, chrysanthemums symbolize duration and long life.

homepage-featured.Name: Large Platter - Blue and White Hope Plate
homepage-featured.Body:
Hand thrown and painted large 40cm platter - perfect as a fruit plate or bowl.

This beautiful piece has Plum tree and Bamboo motifs

In Chinese philosophy, the Plum tree's blossom is a symbol of winter ending and a herald of spring. The tree's pale pink blossoms are cherished because they bloom vibrantly and so bravely amidst the winter chill. They symbolise perseverance and hope, as well as, beauty thriving in adverse circumstances. Bamboo is a symbol of strength, flexibility, and growth.

Height 23cm x Width 23cm

During the manufacturing process imperfections have been deliberately created. These give the item an older, used  and more 'antique' look than it would have if it had been made to be perfect. There may be parts of a design missing, slight bumps or other surface imperfections or irregularities in the glaze. These are meant to give the careworn and well used look of a much older item to a recently manufactured product. This distressed finish is not to be regarded as a fault.

objects-and-accessories.Name: Giant Tianqiuping Vase - Blue and White
objects-and-accessories.Body:
This is a large vase with a tubular neck and globular body painted with a stylised, large-headed lotus meander. This is a classic Qing dynasty design.

Traditionally known as a tianqiuping vase these usually had Budhist motifs - loved for their soothing shape.

This can be used as a ornament or a floor vase with pampass grasses or any large stemmed flowers.

Magnificent ceramic horses in a light blue glaze are reproductions of horses produced during China's Tang Dynasty. These items signify the high status of the owner.

These are made to look antique with a slight crackle glaze and rough finish on the stands. Each item faces slightly inwards.

Sold and Delivered as a Pair.

objects-and-accessories.Name: Classic Blue Foo Dogs, Pair
objects-and-accessories.Body:
A pair of Classic Blue ceramic Foo Dogs. Beautiful ornaments for your home.
Foo dogs are symbolic, protective statues – one is female and one is male. The female represents yin and symbolically protects the people dwelling in the home, while the male represents yang, protects the structure itself.

Sold and Delivered as a Pair.

This piece was made in Jingdezhen, China - known as the "Porcelain Capital" because it has been producing Chinese ceramics for at least 1,000 years, and is known for producing the most important and finest quality porcelain in China.

our-products.Name: Floral Planter - Large - Blue and White - Antiqued Look
our-products.Body:
Antiqued Blue and White Floral Planter is a perfect partner for any indoor plants with painted leaves and flower designs. The planter is watertight and will catch excess water that drains through the plant pot. 

Height 23cm x Width 23cm

During the manufacturing process imperfections have been deliberately created. These give the item an older, used  and more 'antique' look than it would have if it had been made to be perfect. There may be parts of a design missing, slight bumps or other surface imperfections or irregularities in the glaze. These are meant to give the careworn and well used look of a much older item to a recently manufactured product. This distressed finish is not to be regarded as a fault.

our-products.Name: Peony hand painted Ginger Jar
our-products.Body:
Peony Ginger Jar.

Peonies bloom in the spring season and symbolise fame, prosperity, and wealth

It was the great Chinese poet Li Bai who compared his mistress Yang Yuhuan’s beauty to peonies. He wrote: “Floating clouds remind me of her clothes, and peonies her face”. In most of the New Year images, the fairy children always hold peonies. The peonies bear people’s wishes for an auspicious and rich new year.

Giant Chrysanthemum Crackle glazed Ginger Jar
our-products.Body:
Crackle Glazed Hand Painted Ginger Jar with vines and Chrysanthemum.

This item is finished with a crackle glaze technique - this makes the item look older and  antiqued and unique as every item is different.

Chrysanthemums are one of the most common flowers in China and are symbolic of autumn and of the ninth lunar month. The Chinese word for chrysanthemum is similar to jū, which means "to remain" and jiǔ which means "long time." Therefore, chrysanthemums symbolize duration and long life.

our-products.Name: Large Platter - Blue and White Hope Plate
our-products.Body:
Hand thrown and painted large 40cm platter - perfect as a fruit plate or bowl.

This beautiful piece has Plum tree and Bamboo motifs

In Chinese philosophy, the Plum tree's blossom is a symbol of winter ending and a herald of spring. The tree's pale pink blossoms are cherished because they bloom vibrantly and so bravely amidst the winter chill. They symbolise perseverance and hope, as well as, beauty thriving in adverse circumstances. Bamboo is a symbol of strength, flexibility, and growth.

This beautiful piece has Plum tree and Bamboo motifs

In Chinese philosophy, the Plum tree's blossom is a symbol of winter ending and a herald of spring. The tree's pale pink blossoms are cherished because they bloom vibrantly and so bravely amidst the winter chill. They symbolise perseverance and hope, as well as, beauty thriving in adverse circumstances. Bamboo is a symbol of strength, flexibility, and growth.
